column1: #Text=All of us will experience loss or several losses at some point in our lives .
#Text=To some , loss is the death of a friend or family member , while to others loss is a valued possession that is stolen , broken or misplaced .
#Text=It would be incorrect to ridicule someone who is grieving for losing an engagement ring , for example , while being understanding of someone whose parent died .
#Text=Both people are experiencing a strong emotion .
#Text=But being philosophical about loss can help us cope and overcome negative feelings .
#Text=Philosophy can help us understand the nature of loss and retain of sense of personal well-being in the face of any eventuality .
#Text=Find the deeper meaning behind why you are feeling loss .
#Text=To what degree are you suffering from the loss ?
#Text=Philosophy asks questions and finds the answers behind these .
#Text=The editor , Alexander George , of ' I Am , Therefore I Think ' confirms that the essence of philosophy lies in questioning :
#Text=" Most people do not realise that many of the questions they have been mulling over ... are at the very root of philosophy .

#Text=In the book ' Call to Love ' , Anthony de Mello defines attachment as :  a state of clinging that comes from the false belief that something or someone is necessary for your happiness .
